metadata.title: CVE-2023-42117 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
[Exim Improper Neutralization of Special Elements Remote Code ExecutionVulnerability]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-42117` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm7
exim4-base - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm7
exim4-config - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm7
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm7
exim4-daemon-light - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm7
eximon4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: exim4 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm7').
